==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|早|正|ls=ic}}, logic of compound unclear. It has been suggested that {{zh-l|*早}} looks like a spoon, so {{zh-l|*是}} may have been the original character for {{och-l|匙|spoon}}. As early as in late bronze inscriptions, {{zh-l|*早}} was replaced with {{zh-l|*日}} to give {{zh-l|*昰}}, which carried over to the small seal script, and ''{{w|Shuowen}}'' considers this a compound of {{zh-l|*日}} + {{zh-l|*正}} (i.e. “right” as the upright sun).

===Etymology===
“This [an independent pronoun] > be right, correct, to be, so”. From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*m-daj ~ *m-di||that; this}}. Cognate with {{cog|bo|དེ||that}}, {{cog|kac|dai}}, {{m|kac|ndai||this}}.

Cognate with {{och-l|寔|this}}, {{och-l|實|this}} and {{och-l|諟|to examine, to consider}}.

===Definitions===
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{lb|zh|obsolete}} [[this]]; this [[thing]]
#* {{zh-x|是日|'''this''' day}}
#* {{zh-x|是 可 忍 ， 孰 不 可 忍 ？|If '''this''' can be tolerated, what cannot?|ref=Analects}}
# {{lb|zh|copulative}} to be.
## {{n-g|indicating that the subject and object are the same.}}
##: {{zh-x|泰晤士河 是 ^英國 第二 長 的 河流。|The River Thames '''is''' the second longest river in the UK.}}
## {{n-g|indicating that the subject has the qualities described by a noun or noun phrase.}}
##: {{zh-x|我 是 老師|I '''am''' a teacher}}
##: {{zh-x|我 是 中國人|I '''am''' Chinese.}}
## {{n-g|indicating a place being occupied by the object, where the place forms the subject.}}
##: {{zh-x|房子 前面 是 禾場。|The threshing floor '''is''' in front of the house.}}
##: {{zh-x|到處 都 是|to '''be''' everywhere}}
# {{n-g|a particle emphasizing the word following it.}}
#: {{zh-x|我 是 昨天 買 的 票。|'''It was''' yesterday when I bought the ticket.}}
#: {{zh-x|我 買 票 是 在 昨天。|'''It was''' yesterday when I bought the ticket.}}
# {{n-g|a particle showing agreement. In this meaning, 是 is stressed.}} [[truly]]; [[indeed]].
#: {{zh-x|天氣 是 冷。|It is '''indeed''' cold.}}
#: {{zh-x|是 ， 長{zhǎng}官 。|'''Yes''', sir.}}
# {{lb|zh|only in compounds}} [[true]], [[correct]]
#* {{zh-x|不是|fault; mistake; wrongdoing}}
#* {{zh-x|你 說 得{de} 是|What you said is '''right'''}}
#* {{zh-x|各 行 其 是|to have each going his own way, i.e., doing what he considers '''right'''}}
#* {{zh-x|共 商 國 是|to discuss national affairs }} (This is a fossil word from Ancient Chinese where 是 originally means "what is right (for the country)", i.e., "laws and policies")
# {{surname|lang=zh}}

====Usage notes====
{{hide box|Usage notes|align=left|
When translated as "[[be|to be]]", {{lang|zh|是}} is used only to link two nouns or nominal expressions.
: {{zh-x|我 是 老師|I '''am''' a teacher}}
: {{zh-x|泰晤士河 是 ^英國 第二 長 的 河流。|The River Thames '''is''' the second longest river in the UK.}}
{{lang|zh|是}} cannot be used to link a noun and an adjective. The following sentence is wrong:
: {{zh-x|這 是 好|*This '''is''' good}}
The correct sentence is
: {{zh-x|這 很 好|This '''is (very)''' good}}
Here, {{zh-l|很}} is used as a filler to link a noun and an adjective and is not interpreted as "very". Not using it would sound unnatural.
A way to use {{lang|zh|是}} with an adjective is to use {{zh-l|的}} after the adjective to turn it into a noun.
: {{zh-x|那 隻 猫 是 黑 的|This cat is black (This cat is a black one)}}}}
